summary: Are federal agencies doing a good job keeping track of the effectiveness of the foreign assistance programs they administer? We looked at how agencies monitor and evaluate these programs. Specifically, we looked at the guidelines the Office of Management and Budget established for federal agencies with foreign assistance programs. We reviewed whether the guidelines incorporated leading practices for monitoring and evaluation, and whether agencies adopted...
title: Foreign Assistance: Federal Monitoring and Evaluation Guidelines Incorporate Most but Not All Leading Practices
